docs.snippet: Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer on Monday pushed against rushing through confirmation hearings scheduled this week for at least seven of President-elect Donald Trump's Cabinet nominees, saying the nominees need a thorough vetting....
docs.lead_paragraph: Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer on Monday pushed against rushing through confirmation hearings scheduled this week for at least seven of President-elect Donald Trump's Cabinet nominees, saying the nominees need a thorough vetting.

headline.main: Schumer Urges Delay in Confirmation Hearings, Says Reviews Incomplete
headline.print_headline: Schumer Urges Delay in Confirmation Hearings, Says Reviews Incomplete

docs.snippet: An attack by militants on an Egyptian police checkpoint in the northern Sinai Peninsula left at least nine people dead on Monday. The group rammed a stolen garbage truck packed with explosives into the checkpoint, setting off clashes with security...
docs.lead_paragraph: An attack by militants on an Egyptian police checkpoint in the northern Sinai Peninsula left at least nine people dead on Monday. The group rammed a stolen garbage truck packed with explosives into the checkpoint, setting off clashes with security forces, officials said.

headline.main: Deadly Checkpoint Attack in Egypt's Sinai

docs.snippet: Whale watchers in Southern California were treated to a rare sighting of Eastern Tropical Pacific killer whales....

headline.main: California Whale Watchers See Rare Orcas, Including Calf

docs.snippet: Two major prescription drug distributors have agreed to pay $36 million to settle a West Virginia lawsuit alleging they fueled West Virginia's opioid epidemic with excessively large shipments of painkillers into the state over several years....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two major prescription drug distributors have agreed to pay $36 million to settle a West Virginia lawsuit alleging they fueled West Virginia's opioid epidemic with excessively large shipments of painkillers into the state over several years.

headline.main: West Virginia Gets $36M to End Suit Against 2 Drug Companies
headline.print_headline: West Virginia Gets $36M to End Suit Against 2 Drug Companies

docs.snippet: The campaign of French presidential hopeful Manuel Valls is losing steam as the Socialists enter a crucial week in picking their candidate, polls show, a scenario that could help Emmanuel Macron....
docs.lead_paragraph: The campaign of French presidential hopeful Manuel Valls is losing steam as the Socialists enter a crucial week in picking their candidate, polls show, a scenario that could help Emmanuel Macron.

headline.print_headline: Ex-Premier Valls Seen Lagging in Bid for French Socialist Presidential Ticket

docs.snippet: The justices appeared deeply skeptical of a Colorado law that makes it hard for criminal defendants whose convictions are overturned to get refunds of fines and restitution....
docs.lead_paragraph: The justices appeared deeply skeptical of a Colorado law that makes it hard for criminal defendants whose convictions are overturned to get refunds of fines and restitution.

headline.main: Supreme Court Seems Wary of Hurdles for Refunds of Fines After Exonerations
headline.print_headline: Skepticism for a Colorado Law on Criminal Fines

docs.snippet: Jewish community centres in several U.S. states were evacuated on Monday after they reported receiving bomb threats, according to the organizations and national umbrella organisation, though no explosives were found and no injuries reported....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jewish community centres in several U.S. states were evacuated on Monday after they reported receiving bomb threats, according to the organizations and national umbrella organisation, though no explosives were found and no injuries reported.

headline.main: Jewish Centres Report Bomb Threats in Several U.S. States
headline.print_headline: Jewish Centres Report Bomb Threats in Several U.S. States

docs.snippet: Ivory Coast's President Alassane Ouattara dismissed the heads of the army, police and gendarmes on Monday after a two-day army mutiny that spread unrest across the West African nation, according to a statement from the presidency....
